sections.title: Images
sections.desc: Images are the most common form of multimedia on the web.
sections.def: Embeds an image into the HTML document.

attrs.desc: Specifies the path to the image.
Provides alternative text if the image can't be displayed.
Set the dimensions of the image.

sections.title: Audio
sections.desc: Audio tag allows a simple way to embed audio files.

attrs.desc: Add play, pause, and volume controls.
Specifies the audio file format for better browser compatibility.

sections.title: Video
sections.desc: Embedding video content is as easy as embedding images and audio.

attrs.desc: Set the dimensions of the video.
Add play, pause, and volume controls.
Automatically starts the video when the page loads.
Mutes the audio of the video by default.

sections.title: Embedding YouTube Videos
sections.desc: You can also embed videos from platforms like YouTube.
sections.def: Embeds external content, such as a YouTube video.

attrs.desc: Specifies whether the iframe should have a border. Set to 0 for no border.
Specifies a list of features that the iframe is allowed to use, like autoplay, fullscreen, and more.

sections.title: Embedding Other Multimedia Content
sections.desc: The object and embed elements are used to embed media like PDFs, Flash, and other types of content

eles.desc: Embeds external content, like a PDF or a Flash file.
object element is more versatile and allows you to provide fallback content.

sections.title: Image Maps
sections.desc: Image maps allow you to define clickable areas on an image that can link to different pages.

attrs.desc: Defines the shape of the clickable area (rect, circle, poly).
Specifies the coordinates for the clickable area.

sections.title: Canvas and SVG
sections.desc: Used for more advanced graphics and animations.

eles.desc: Used for drawing graphics on the fly using JavaScript.
XML-based markup for creating vector graphics.
